subject: Re: [junit] small help please for junit beginner
msgSnippet: ... try set CLASSPATH=%CLASSPATH%;c: newd junit.jar; - setting it this way avoids removing the previous classpath entries. ...  ...  ... You need
messageBody:
At 01:35 PM 15/06/01, you wrote:
>Hi,
>I have downloaded junit framework. I'm using
>Windows98. I have created a directory newd in C and
>unzipped junit3.6.zip.
>I have added set CLASSPATH=c:\newd\junit.jar in the


try "set CLASSPATH=%CLASSPATH%;c:\newd\junit.jar;" - setting it this way
avoids removing the previous classpath entries.

>autoexec.bat and started the TestRunner tool in
>c:\newd.
>I have tried the following Money class:

<snip>

>I have the MoneyTest class as follows:

<snip>


>I have the follwoing problems and questions:
>1. Do I have to compile Money and MoneyTest class
>manually or the tool does this for me?

You need to compile them first.

>2. When I have tried to compile MoneyTest, the
>following error appears:
> package junit.framework.*; does not exist.
>How can I solve this problem. I though that it is
>enaough to set the class path to the junit.jar in the
>autoexec.bat.

Have you tried executing autoexec.bat from dos? (i.e. open a dos window, cd
to c:\ and execute it.) Does it give any errors? Type in "set classpath" -
does it show what you expect?



>3. When I write MoneyTest in the TestRunner class
>field and click Run button, a message "class not found
>"MoneyTest" ". Is it because the MoneyTest class not
>compiled, or there is another reason?

See 1.



Jim
